60   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
61   | 
62   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
63   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
64   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
65   | 
66   | /*++++
67   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
68   |  ** 									     **
69   |  **   Function:		cmdIsLoaded					     **
70   |  ** 									     **
71   |  **   Description:	Callback function for 'is-loaded'		     **
72   |  ** 									     **
73   |  **   First Edition:	2000/04/12					     **
74   |  ** 									     **
75   |  **   Parameters:	ClientData	 client_data			     **
76   |  **			Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl interp.**
77   |  **			int		 objc		Number of arguments  **
78   |  **			Tcl_Obj		*objv[]		Argument array	     **
79   |  ** 									     **
80   |  **   Result:		int	TCL_OK		Successful completion	     **
81   |  **				TCL_ERROR	Any error		     **
82   |  ** 									     **
83   |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
84   |  **					this function is called in order to  **
85   |  **					control everything		     **
86   |  ** 									     **
87   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
88   |  ++++*/
89   | 
90   | int cmdIsLoaded(
91   | 	ClientData client_data,
92   | 	Tcl_Interp * interp,
93   | 	int objc,
94   | 	Tcl_Obj * CONST84 objv[]
95   | ) {
96   | 	uvec           *pathlist,		/** List of module-pathes    **/
97   | 	               *modulelist;		/** List of modules          **/
98   | 	char           *modulepath,		/** Contents of MODULEPATH   **/
99   | 	               *notloaded_flag;		/** conflicting module	     **/
100  | 	int             i, j, k,		/** Loop counters            **/
101  | 	                numpaths, nummodules;
102  | 					/** Size of the according arrays     **/
103  |     /** 
104  |      **  Parameter check. Usage is 'is-loaded <module> [<module> ...]'
105  |      **/
106  | 	if (objc < 2) {
107  | 		if (OK !=
108  | 		    ErrorLogger(ERR_USAGE, LOC, Tcl_GetString(objv[0]),
109  | 				"is-loaded-modules", NULL))
110  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
111  | 	}
112  |     /**
113  |      **  There's no prerequisite check in case of whatis
114  |      **/
115  | 	if (g_flags & M_WHATIS)
116  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
117  |     /**
118  |      **  Load the MODULEPATH and split it into a list of paths
119  |      **/
120  | 	if (!(modulepath = (char *)getenv("MODULEPATH"))) {
121  | 		if (OK != ErrorLogger(ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL))
122  | 			return (TCL_ERROR); /** ------ EXIT (FAILURE) -----> **/
123  | 	}
124  | 	if (!(pathlist = SplitIntoList(modulepath, &numpaths, _colon)))
125  | 		return (TCL_OK);	/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
126  |     /**
127  |      **  Check/Display all passed modules
128  |      **/
129  | 	notloaded_flag = Tcl_GetString(objv[1]);
130  | 	for (i = 1; i < objc && Tcl_GetString(objv[i]) && notloaded_flag; i++) {
131  | 		for (j = 0; j < numpaths && notloaded_flag; j++) {
132  | 			if (NULL == (modulelist = SortedDirList(
133  | 					uvec_vector(pathlist)[j],
134  | 					   Tcl_GetString(objv[i]),
135  | 					   &nummodules)))
136  | 				continue;
137  | 	    /**
138  | 	     **  Now actually check if the prerequisites are fullfilled
139  | 	     **  The notloaded_flag controls the exit from both loops in case
140  | 	     **  a prerequisite is missing.
141  | 	     **/
142  | 			for (k = 0; k < nummodules && notloaded_flag; k++) {
143  | 				if (!IsLoaded (interp,
144  | 				uvec_vector(modulelist)[k], NULL, NULL)) {
145  | 					notloaded_flag = Tcl_GetString(objv[i]);
146  | 				} else {
147  | 					notloaded_flag = NULL;
148  | 				}
149  | 			}
150  | 	    /**
151  | 	     **  Free what has been allocted in the loop
152  | 	     **/
153  | 			FreeList(&modulelist);
154  | 		} /** for( j) **/
155  | 	} /** for( i) **/
156  |     /**
157  |      **  Display an error message if this was *NOT* display mode and a
158  |      **  missing prerequisite has been found
159  |      **/
160  | 	Tcl_SetResult(interp, notloaded_flag ? "0" : "1", TCL_STATIC);
161  | 
162  | 	return (TCL_OK);
163  | 
164  | } /** End of 'cmdIsLoaded' **/
